Reference version 0.1.0

All functions

as_numeric

Converts a vector of elements to numeric elements

AZRsimpop

Population simulation

AZRxdotcalc

Return evaluated RHS of AZRmodel ODEs

chunk_ode

chunk an ode into parts split on +/- signs

create_model

azrmod class

diagram

create a diagram of the ODE system of a model

export_azrmod

Export of AZRmodel

fclose

Closes a file

fileparts

Get the various parts of a file with path string.

fopen

Opens a file and creates the folder if needed

fwrite

Writes text into an opened file

generate_diagram_syntax

generate the digraph syntax from a model

get_chunk_signs

determine the signs for each of the chunks in an ode

get_cmpt_relationships

get compartment relationships

get_inputs

determine the names of the inputs in the ode system of equations

is_azrmod

Check function if it is an azrmod

isnumericVector

Checks if a vector consists of numeric entries

mkdirp

Creates a folder if it does not yet exist

model_to_text

provide the textual representation of a model as a vector of lines

plot

Plot a simulated model

position_and_sign

get the position and assign it a sign value from a str_locate_all output

prepare_inputs

prepare inputs from the system of equations for diagrammer

print

Generic print function for AZRmodels

recombine_parens

recombine equations in parens for one nested layer

rmdir

Removes a folder

sep_values

light wrapper for collapse diagrammer separator requirements

shiny_plot

Use shiny to graphically represent the contents of a dataframe

simulate

Simulate an AZRmodel

strexplode

Splits a string based on a separator substring

strexplodePC

Splits strings by separator only if separators not in parentheses

strlocateall

Returns indices of occurrence of strings in strings

strmatch

Returns indices of elements in a vector of that match a search string

strremWhite

Removes all white spaces in a string

strrepM

String replacement function

strtrimM

Truncates strings by removing leading and trailing white spaces

text_to_model

convert vector of strings to a model object

write_model

export model to a file
